meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being dual.
meanings.sent1: The duality of the twins' personalities was evident in their contrasting interests.
meanings.sent2: The duality of light and darkness is a common theme in literature.
meanings.sent3: The duality of the clown's happy face and sad eyes made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The duality of the mountain's peak and valley symbolized life's ups and downs.
meanings.sent5: The duality of hot and cold created a perfect balance in the dish.

meanings.definition: An instance of opposition or contrast between two concepts or aspects.
meanings.sent1: The duality between work and play can be challenging to balance.
meanings.sent2: The duality of love and hate is a common theme in Shakespeare's plays.
meanings.sent3: The duality of the cat's curiosity and laziness always amused the owner.
meanings.sent4: The duality of the storm's fury and calm aftermath left a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The duality of success and failure is a natural part of life.
